location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 10 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is reporting that the custody of the batille (a small sea going vessel) belonging to Rama bin Janbir [Raḥmah bin Jābir] has been transferred from Colonel Brackley Kennett to the Resident. It is noted that the vessel is being held at Bushire, pending the promised restitution to the Shaikhs of Bahrain. It therefore submits the expenditure for transporting her from Bassidore [Bāsaʻīdū] and guarding her at Bushire to the Bombay Government.
